hi: im a linux noob, and im looking for help with a problem im having
I'm using Ubuntu 9.04 with an ATI Radeon HD4830 video card, and I cannot seem to get the sound to work through HDMI.
Sound actually comes to my tv through the video card in windows.. and i have a friend get it working once, until i restarted ubuntu, then it quit
there id an hdmi sound output, yes
I have, and it is there, and HDMI is set as the sound output device
but, i still get no sound at all... and no it's not muted, by the way
is it unmuted in the alsamixer?
do you load the alsa mixer by; alsamixer -V al ?
it was supposed to let you see ALL of the audio devices to ensure that it wasn't muted
as I have never used HDMI in ubuntu that is the only advice I can offer
because you were supposed to do: alsamixer -V al
-V is view, then you have to set what you would like to view, al for all

using the arrow keys you can navigate left and right, up and down will change the volume level and m with mute/unmute, if there is a MM under the bar it is muted, try scrolling over and see if HDMI shows anywhere
if you do not find HDMI anywhere I would suggest just trying to unmute everything that is not common, things like "LINE" does not need to be unmuted for instance
